intro: Chamissomneia, commonly known as the "moonflower of the Andes," is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. The plant has a compact, herbaceous structure with hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
